Kim Yong Nam Meets Angolan Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Angolan Delegation 
    Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola headed by Member of the Political Bureau and Chairman of the Control Commission of its Central Committee Ferreira Pinto at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
 On hand were Kim Thae Jong, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned. 
 On the occasion, the head of the delegation asked Kim Yong Nam to convey to leader Kim Jong Il greetings of Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of the Central Committee of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola and president of the Republic of Angola.    
 Noting that the government and people of Angola will positively support the just cause of the Korean people to reunify the country and build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, he wished the Korean people greater success in their struggle under the leadership of great Songun.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Monument to Victory in Fatherland Liberation War
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Monument to Victory in Fatherland Liberation War 
    Pyongyang, October 9 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were laid before the Monument to Victory in the Fatherland Liberation War on Sunday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Present at the floral basket-laying ceremony were Kim Il Chol, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Kim Kuk Thae, Kwak Pom Gi and Kim Yong Dae who is chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party and officials of the party, military and power organs, social organizations, ministries and national institutions and officers and men of the Korean People's Army and working people in the city.
 A floral basket was laid before the main theme sculpture "Victory" of the monument in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK.    
 Then floral baskets were laid in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, social organizations, ministries, national institutions, KPA units, science, education, public health and media organs, party and power organs and factories in Pyongyang.    
 Written on the ribbons of the floral baskets were letters "Victory and Glory to the Servicepersons of the Heroic Korean People's Army!"
 The participants paid noble respects to the servicepersons of the heroic KPA who resolutely beat back the armed invasion of the imperialist allied forces and honorably defended the freedom and independence of the country and the gains of the Party and revolution by displaying matchless bravery and mass heroism in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War.

Kim Jong Il's Work Published in South Africa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in South Africa
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- The famous work of leader Kim Jong Il "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was published in booklet by the Multi Print Publishing House of South Africa on Sept. 30.
 The work, made public on Oct. 2, Juche 84 (1995), serves as an undying great programme for party construction and activities as it proudly reviewed the glorious history of the WPK which paved a new path for building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicated ways of developing the party into the eternal party of the President.

Pak Pong Ju Meets Chinese Government Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Meets Chinese Government Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had a talk with the Chinese government delegation led by Wu Yi, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Yun Su Ryong, vice-minister of Construction and Building Materials Industries, Ri Ryong Nam, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, officials concerned and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan led by So Man Sul, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, arrived here today to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 It was greeted at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yu Ho, director of the Bureau of Service for Overseas Compatriots, and others.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Russian President Arrives Here
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Russian President Arrives Here
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Konstantin Borisovich Pulikovski, special envoy of the Russian president to the Far East region of the Russian Federation, and his party arrived here today to visit the DPRK to participate in celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 They were greeted at the airport by Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Ro Tu Chol, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and other officials concerned, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Gennadiyevich Karlov and staff members of the Russian embassy.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Cuban Party Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Cuban Party Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, today met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Communist Party of Cuba led by Oscar Martinez Cordoves, deputy head of the International Department of the Central Committee of the CPC, on a visit to Korea to participate in celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the WPK at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Talks between WPK and PLMA Delegations
articles.content:
Talks between WPK and PLMA Delegations
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola were held here today.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the activities of their parties and exchanged views on developing the friendly and cooperative ties between the two parties and the issues of mutual concern.    
 Participating in the talks from the WPK side were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned and from the opposite side members of the delegation of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola headed by Member of the Political Bureau and Chairman of the Control Commission of its Central Committee Ferreira Pinto.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Awarded Diploma of Honorary Academician and Badge
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Awarded Diploma of Honorary Academician and Badge
    Pyongyang, October 8 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was nominated as an honorary academician by the Russian People's Academy of Sciences, a public complex.
 He was the first head of state and party leader of a foreign country to be nominated as an honorary academician of the academy.
 A diploma of an honorary academician and a badge of the academy were handed to a staff member of the DPRK embassy in Moscow by the president of the academy at a meeting held in Moscow on Sept. 30 under the sponsorship of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in celebration of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
